reviews.text:
Very loud place. Service was mid to low level. Waitress was impatient and had no patient for our dietary requests..
Not going back !! Waist of time and money !

I came to Uva late at night around 11 p.m. with a few friends, and even though the kitchen was about to close in ten minutes, the staff still welcomed us and let us order. The service was excellent, super attentive and friendly.
The food was fresh and really good, and I found the prices to be very reasonable. The ambience was cozy and inviting, and since itâ€™s almost Halloween, their decorations definitely added to the vibe.
Overall, great experience, good food, great service, and a fun atmosphere. Well done! ğŸ‘

This is third time coming back here! I loved it every single time. The only thing I don't like is the drinks, lol. But that's honestly ME. Because I prefer sweet wines and drinks and every time, I have tried a "sweet" wine from UVA, well, it wasn't. They were always dry, and I don't like it at all. The food has never failed, and the aesthetic is absolutely stunning! I went last week and it's Halloween dressed but it's still classy. I will be returning!

I really wanted to like Uva after having dined at Uva Next Door and loved it.

We had a reservation yet still had to wait over 25 minutes outside on the sidewalk for our table. I understand a short, few minute wait but that was crazy. It begs the question whatâ€™s the point of making a reservation in the first place?

Inside was extremely busy and deafeningly loud. The tables were tiny and way too small for the amount of plates, glasses and bottles on the table.

The vibe was cosy and spookily decorated for Halloween but it was just too crowded to enjoy it properly. At times, my server could not hear me and I had to shout to give my order.

The olive oil they serve with the bread is very tasty; the dried meats were good, but sliced very thinly. The calamari was ok; the predominant flavour was a burnt herb.

The menu is pretty big but the portions are rather small. I had the pappardelle ragu; the pasta itself was lovely and wonderfully cooked, but I found the ragu flavourless.

They have a good wine selection and are happy to make your cocktail of choice if they have the ingredients. Service was a little slow.

All in all, it was decent, but I was definitely expecting a lot more.

Food and atmosphere were great but Maddi really took this meal to the next level. Her service and attention to detail were amazing. She was incredibly helpful with allergies, had awesome recommendations, and is an all-around rockstar. We will be returning!
The vibes are immaculate but the plates are small and they need more staff, would prioritize wine and chats over going for a meal

Sadly incredibly average and disappointing. Much better Italian food available for this price. The pizza style focaccia is akin to a Schwanâ€™s frozen pizza. 4 sip cocktails over hotel style ice at $19 sit right with the overpriced theme as do the pasta portions. Sadly very underwhelming for dinner. Brunch is much better all round, with better portions and better flavor, but Iâ€™d advise to skip dinner. Overpriced and average at best.

Iâ€™m a UES local and have been to Uva many times for drinks â€” itâ€™s always a fun spot. Since so many people recommended eating there, I finally decided to give it a try. The restaurant itself is very cozy, but unfortunately, the food was pretty disappointing.

We ordered the beef carpaccio, which had barely any beef â€” it was mostly arugula and cheese. The pappardelle with veal ragu tasted oddly like it had potatoes in it (I think those were actually big chunks of carrot). We also tried the short ribs, which were quite bland and tasted as if theyâ€™d been boiled before serving.

There are so many great restaurants in the UES, so Iâ€™d skip Uva for the food.
Lively
Food is great but on the weekend it is very very very loud. Itâ€™s not the restaurant itâ€™s the customers .. donâ€™t understand why everyone is so loud.. 93Db on the scale btw

I love that this place stays open late and still offers their full menuâ€”itâ€™s great to enjoy a tasty, high-quality dinner even at night. So far, Iâ€™ve really enjoyed everything Iâ€™ve tried. The food is consistently good, and the service is quick and friendly. Its definitely a spot i will keep going back to.

A great Italian restaurant on the Upper East side of Manhattan. Most of us had pasta, which we really enjoyed. I especially enjoyed the gnocchi. There was a nice selection of wines and beers. We would definitely come here again.

UVA is a classic UES spot that never disappointsâ€”perfect for a date night or catching up with a friend.

The food is always reliable. I can never come here without ordering the truffle gnocchiâ€”itâ€™s rich, flavorful, and honestly hard to beat anywhere else. The gorgonzola pear salad was light, refreshing, and very good. The meatballs were just okayâ€”small in size (six per order, good for sharing) with a sauce that tasted more onion-forward than I remember. Not bad, but not a standout.

Service is consistently strongâ€”the food came out quickly, our waitress was attentive, and the whole staff is always accommodating. A neighborhood staple for a reason.
Best food in nyc. Patty, Luigi and Massimo are the best!!
Excellent excellent food incredible service canâ€™t ask for more !!!!

Overpriced. We were given the specials menu, but none of the items on it had prices listed. Both my friend and I ordered the truffle pasta, and when the bill came, we were surprised to see it was $45 per plate - $90 just for the pasta. Thatâ€™s on me for not asking the price, but they really should have made it clear on the menu.

In total, with one drink each, a shared salad, and the main courses, the bill came to $146 before tip - over $175 with a 20% tip. It's a cute place, but not worth that much money.

Disappointing. The tables are too small and too close together. The chairs are uncomfortable. The room is so loud & crowded you canâ€™t have a conversation. They refuse to bring you bread until after you order your entrÃ©e. The appetizers came in four minutes, proving that nothing was made to order. It tasted microwave hot. The oil used for frying was old and bitter. The waitstaff was kind of rude and impatient. The pasta sauce tasted like it was made with  cheap tomato paste. It had that cheap, bitter aftertaste. The duck was so tough that it wasnâ€™t chewable. The menu does a terrible job describing the food that they bring you. Literally nothing about the experience was good or noteworthy. I have no idea why this place is so crowded. There are so many mediocre Italian places on the upper east side. All of them are better than this.

My friend and I were so excited to come to Uva for the first time on a Saturday night. We have both lived on the UES and had never been. So, we were thrilled when we got a reservation for 7:45 on a Saturday! We were greeted by a very friendly host and were seated immediately. Then we met our waitressâ€¦who couldnâ€™t have been less friendlyâ€¦
Her tone and demeanor towards us was unfriendly from the moment she came to take our drink order. Our food took over 40 minutes to come out and after we ordered our appetizers, she did not come to check on us onceâ€¦while we saw her tending to other tables and saw other tables that arrived after us get their orders before we did, as well as multiple rounds of drinks. By the time our food finally came out, I was starved. It was clear they forgot about us and scrambled to get our food out quickly. The shrimp in my pasta were grey..clearly not fully cooked. My pasta was drastically under-seasoned. Our waitress, again, avoided us. Didnâ€™t come over to ask if we were happy with our food. By the time we had finished eating what we could, we asked for the check before they had even cleared our plates. I donâ€™t know what was going on and I canâ€™t remember the last time I had a BAD meal in NYCâ€¦until today. I was beyond disappointed by UVA. A place I have been dying to try for years. Itâ€™s safe to say Iâ€™ll never be coming back and I wouldnâ€™t recommend it to anyone.
Frozen expresso martini ğŸ’œğŸ’œğŸ’œğŸ’œ
Delicious Italian food. We went for a birthday celebration and sat on the patio. The vibe was excellent and it felt like a little out of the way place to enjoy good food and conversation.
Uva is always good. Food is super consistent and has been for years. Love it!

I don't know why I haven't left a review before. I have been coming to UVA for a number of years now and consistently the food and service is on point. I truly appreciate that they have cocktail onions for a Gibson. Thank you! I will be returning soon.
Fantastic Pollo meatballs with mushrooms, spaghetti with veal meatballs and vegetarian meatballs.
UVA has been around for years, always great food, friendly service and fun atmosphere

Good
Nice

Very good food, a bit hot inside. Sunday dinner was very good.  The one thing that stood out was the service. Beyond good, so many choices in the city Uva is an excellent one. Plus Gluten-free options.

The last day of our New York stay we wanted to have real authentic Italian food after our Guggenheim visit.... yes, this place was featured at NHONY but to me that would not matter. Pappardelle and Gnocchi Ricotta were our main dishes after a delicious salad (Bianca) and polpettine. Delicious, full of flavor and obviously using the correct ingredients as we did not feel drowsy afterwards (seems to be an issue with Italian places in our experience - maybe an issue California?). Finished our meal with real gelato and a torta di mandorle (almond tart). Ambiance? The place is quite dark but luckily we were able to sit at the back patio which helped a LOT. Quiet and plenty of daylight, while still easily accessible for the staff. Great place.

Love this place! The atmosphere is awesome very romantic vibes, dimly lit many candles. Thereâ€™s also a seating area in the back that has a glass ceiling so the light comes through if youâ€™re more into a sunny atmosphere over a dimly lit one. The food was great I will be back for the pasta & lots of cheese selections!

Great location and ambiance, brought my little one and friends to their "meatball monday" prix fixe which is a great vibe.  Food was very good, reasonably priced, and service was attentive and prompt.

Very Italian food I've had in New York. The portions are on the smaller side. The gnocchi were full of flavor and a perfect consistency. The pasta my friend ordered was as good. The desserts were not as impressive as the main entree, but still good. The atmosphere is also somewhere between cozy and modern. It gets very busy.
Top class, Service and very good food

UVA is a cozy, inviting neighborhood gem on the UES, offering delicious Italian cuisine. I always start with the pancetta or soppressata--both are exceptional! The pasta dishes never disappoint, but the standout is the ricotta gnocchi, served in a decadent black truffle and chive sauce--creamy, flavorful, and unforgettable. Another must-try is the melanzane alla parmigiana, a comforting eggplant parmesan reminiscent of lasagna, but lighter and just as satisfying. With its warm ambiance and top-notch food, UVA is the perfect spot for date nights and great vibes!
All the greate! Atmosphere, food, service, all!

Beautiful spot to go for a birthday dinner. Menu is great, me and my friends shared the Ragu Pappardelle , the eggplant lasagna, the pesto pasta , the caprese salad, and the meatballs. Loved that I could order half a portion of a pasta cause I wasnâ€™t feeling like eating too much after the apps, so you have that option. Prices were a bit higher than I expected.

Service was ok. Server made good recommendations and gave a good service overall.

Private dinner in a room I honestly didnâ€™t know about - a beautiful downstairs wine cellar and dining room. Staff were awesome. Cocktails and wine very good. Food excellent. Desserts excellent. Weâ€™ve eaten here before but this was special and they did a great job. Kudos.
Alex Ferrigan is the best waitress we have ever had ! The food was incredible, the drinks were superb, the environment was elegant and  everyone was polite.
Nice Italian place in the neighborhood

Everything was great
Bartender well they were both excellent

Nice Italian eatery.  Got my vegetarian options sorted. Decent pour in the wine; no shrinkflation. Super impressive service. Quick/attentive and friendly.
Customers were family friendly, diverse and easy.
go for the open air sitting at the back.
My fav restaurant in NYC

A must visit
Comfy and comfortable.
Food is Delicious definitely.
Great vibes for an intimate date night. Food was meh (not good but not bad). There are too many amazing restaurants to waste your time eating here.
This is my wifeâ€™s favorite Italian spot. We love going here. Pasta is soo good. I love the pesto
The owner is very nice person and the food is outstanding.

ê´œì°®ì€ê³³ ì ë‹¹íˆ ë‹¤ë…€ì˜¬ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ”ê³³

Wonderful resturaunt and a fantastic experience! The waitress was charming and kept the flow of food at a steady pace so that we weren't overwhelmed by all of our food options, making the meal a steady four course experience. The food was fresh and delicious in flavour, perfectly cooked and prepared. This is a wonderful date spot and one I would gladly recommend to my friends!

Our love affair with Italian food continued with a very good dinner at Uva (reservations recommended on prime nights). We were seated to an absolutely packed restaurant at our promised time and noise levels were on the average end with pretty much all tables occupied. The restaurants felt sufficiently staffed though, and there was absolutely no service issue, in fact, it was fantastic.

Uva has a very romantic vibe to it, and as inviting as their cocktail and wine list looked, our dry January had comfortably flowed into March, so we got straight to ordering our dinner which included their ROBIOLA CHEESE AND BLACK TRUFFLES ($12) and POLENTA TARTUFATA ($19) as appetizers - both absolutely fantastic, but the Robiola being the winner.

For mains, we got a few pastas including RIGATONI ALLA SICILIANA ($26), CAVATELLI AL FIOR DI PESTO ($26), and PENNE GRATINATE ($26) - Cavatelli being an absolute winner!

Their desserts though were really fantastic, especially their TIRAMISU ($11) which was very delicious. We will definitely return here again!

Went to this place for dinner. They really got a big place inside also have outdoor sitting. I ordered gnocchi pasta, seafood soup. The food served at good temperature. Also the taste was good too. However, they made the place so dark with low light that itâ€™s not giving a good ambience.

Came here on a cozy Thursday before Christmas. We had a reservation but they make you wait until your entire party is there. Our full party arrived and they had a wait an additional 30 minutes until a table was ready for us which was ridiculous. The tables are also VERY small and close together so you may be constantly bumped into and not enough room for plates on the table. However the food came out fast and was absolutely delicious. We ordered mushroom bruschetta, fried artichokes, truffle gnocchi, eggplant parmigiana, and seafood stew. The food was good enough to go back but experience may be disappointing.

The restaurant by itself is pretty cute, the ambiance is really nice although it may be a little dark. The food is delicious, every single entree and starter is amazing. I recommend the fried artichoke and the gnocchi. We loved everything, the desserts are algo pretty good and rich in flavor.

Itâ€™s good that it open late night, so we stopped buy around 11pm. The waitress was friendly at first but after we placed the order, we never saw her again. We were sitting with empty glasses and busboy came to ask us for last call and tell us the kitchen is closing if we want something more. He was amazing really!
Food was good. I donâ€™t like pesto, but felt like having it that night and didnâ€™t regret. Also the polenta with truffle and ricotta was the best I ever had
The service was amazing; they make you feel special. Everything was quickâ€”the food arrived fast and was delicious! Everything was really good! We ordered pasta

Food 8/10
Solid traditional pasta, a very local spot on the UES. The gnocchi was fluffy and chewy at the same time, super filling I couldnâ€™t finish it. Calamari turns out wasnâ€™t fried, but came in a salad, which was really good too.

Atmosphere 8/10
Definitely a place you come for an authentic Italian experience, loud yet elegant, a lot is going on but itâ€™s organized and makes sense.

Service 8/10
Good recommendations.

Will probably come back on dinner time to make better opinion after reading the reviews.

My experience is 3 on 5. I had appetizers, because it was for a solo light lunch. The taste is good. I really loved seeing this very wide and diverse menu. Which is really different compared to Italians in the city usually with the same menu over and over again. But this one was sooo different makes you want to come back; plus many of the options are vegetarian and mouth watering. BuT I was left on an average impression because I felt that the staff didn't care that much about the customers, I am not talking only about myself but even other customers. Really I was left with an impression of not that good service. Almost felt like I was disturbing the staff on their personal time. ğŸ˜³

Great little place to stop and have a drink and an amazing charcuterie board!  Our waiter was awesome!  It was nice to speak Italian with him. Our espresso martinis were amazing!  We sat in a cozy section by the bar. I felt like I was in Italy!  Our charcuterie boars was filled with delicious treats. My favorite was the cheese and pickled onions (yup pickled onions). Looking forward to going back and ordering a whole meal!!!

The ambiance is very nice. The staff are nice and friendly. The service is extremely quick and very efficient. I'd dare to say almost too quick. We ordered the burrata, the pizza foccacia and the gnocchi. The burrate was ok, not really super creamy but it was just ok. The foccacia was delicious and the gnocchi was outstanding. I'd for sure go back. I highly recommend!

Excelente lugar para cenar en una cita o grupo de amigos. Ambiente agradable y muy buen servicio. Imperdibles las alcachofas fritas y los gnocchis de trufa. El branzino igual muy bueno. Seguro regreso!
Mi unico feedback es que la mÃºsica puede ser un poco molesta si estas cerca de la bocina.

@uvanyc was so lovely. the fava bean ğŸ«˜ salad ğŸ¥— + ceaser salad were delicious appetizing. fava bean was better in fact this dish inspired me to eat more fava beans ğŸ˜˜ the roasted tomato ğŸ… soup was cream based, which i normally donâ€™t like bc of my lactose intolerance that i ignore. this was lovely. both the gnocchi and pesto pasta were very good and very well made. that being said, i would not order the gnocchi again. iâ€™m not a cream sauce girl so my tummy hurt after eating this ğŸ˜©ğŸ¥º #notcute also, you guys know idc for fancy desserts but this was absolutely wonderful - the perfect way to end the meal.
â€¢
â€¢
overall, uva IS a must try ! fava bean salad, specialty soup, and the almond cake are officially branded as a NYC must have. the Caesar salad was good but i would order another when i return. i would order different pasta ğŸ dishes. something a little more refreshing that pairs well w the rest of the courses. BUT if you like cream sauces, GET THE gnocchi!!!! ALSO vibes were immaculate, this place was gorgeous

The waiter was simply a pleasure, very professional and attentive.  The whole experience was quite nice. The food came out pretty much right after I ordered it. They took the dishes and refilled my glass regularly.  The food was ok. The Parppedelle and involtini melanzane were delicious. But the carpaccio manzo was underwhelming. The mood was very romantic, so I wouldn't go just because the food.

GNOCCHI DI RICOTTA = foodgasm. Iâ€™ve been coming here for 10 years and it never disappoints. There was a time it was different, but now since they have the outdoor area, itâ€™s never more than a 20 min wait. So many areas to sit betweenâ€¦

It's a beautiful restaurant. The service, especially that of the lady who serves for the terrace in the front is unbelievably efficient and professional; my biggest compliment and respect to the place would go to the server without a doubt.â€¦

Popular neighborhood staple for dinner, date night or brunch! Consistently excellent food, service and atmosphere inside or outside. The homemade pappardelle ragu and the homemade gnocchi are always popular and delicious, as well as the frisee poached pear salad. Nutella lovers, save room for the Nutella sponge cake with ice cream for dessert!

I've been coming here for years, prices have increased, yet fair for the area and is reflected in the attentive service and good food. Without reservations, a busy bike lane and neighboring businesses, be prepared for a crowded wait during peak times. Get here early to avoid long waits.

With a world of food options in NYC and hyped up and pricey restaurants, itâ€™s nice to find hidden gems and very affordable restaurants like Uva! We went here for lunch and were pleasantly surprised at the freshness of the ingredients andâ€¦

Uva is a hidden gem in the UES for Italian food. Perhaps itâ€™s not so hidden anymore since the pandemic, as they have the largest space for outdoor dining Iâ€™ve seen so far...
Pre-covid they were always busy and I had always had to make a reservation in advance, but now they have so many tables set up that you can go without making a Rez. I went on a Tuesday night and it was packed, having to wait 15 minutes, which wasnâ€™t so bad at all.
The staff is friendly and the food is excellent. Also since Covid, they have you scan a barcode to view the menu which is nice.

Iâ€™ve tried a few different dishes here but most recently had the Bigoletti di Barbabietole and tried the Rigatoni alla Siciliana, with the Brussels sprouts as a side. All were delicious.

Regarding drinks, my friend and I tried the Red Sangria and the Pinacolada first. I wasnâ€™t a hugee fan of the sangria as it just tasted like regular red wine, and the pinacolada was on the average side - wasnâ€™t really a fan of the coconut flakes in it. We also tried the margaritas, which were good. They werenâ€™t like a classic margarita but I did like them because they were a little bit different.

The food is what really stands out here, and would recommend to anyone in the area looking for delicious Italian food.

The truffle gnocchi is to die for! We liked it so much we ordered another plate of it, and it arrived fresh and hot, like biting into a warm cloud. Iâ€™d come again and again just for if. The pesto pasta is also great, tastes very freshly made. Came as a close 2nd to the gnocchi. The burrata appetizer is also good and beautifully plated.
Only downside is that it does get very noisy when packed and the tables are very close to eachother, making noise unavoidable. However, the great food makes up for it. Definitely one of the best spots in NYC.

This cozy Italian gem is a "must indulge".
We were introduced to it by our daughter and step-son who just relocated to Brooklyn from. Los Angeles.  The food was amazing and the atmosphere was very coolâ€¦

We were seated quickly but it wasnâ€™t a particularly warm welcome. It took ages for our server to introduce himself, meanwhile he was taking orders from tables seated after us. Order-taking was efficient to the point of being brusque. Questions were answered, but answered tersely. No one was rude and we were taken care of, but it felt oddly rushed and transactional for an old-school Italian spot.

The food was good but not so outstanding Iâ€™d make a special trip for it.

The grilled shrimp was fresh and well cooked, although the avocado, tomato and palm heart salad was a little underwhelming. The burrata was admittedly awesome in both flavor and presentation, with the fava bean accompaniment surprising me with how well it paired with the cheese. The gnocchi di ricotta was good but a little heavy for my taste, but thatâ€™s probably on me. (I have no idea what the other reviewer complaining about portion size is talking about; the portions were so big I couldnâ€™t finish.)

The garden space is nice, though cramped, and the chairs were a little uncomfortable. It was also louder than I expected (with another large party in the space), so it wasnâ€™t quite as relaxed and romantic as I was picturing in my head when I suggested the place to my family.

One thing I will say is that the prices seem outrageously high for what you get. I know NYC is expensive and people have to make a living, but $27 for a bowl of gnocchi? For the prices we paid, Iâ€™m accustomed to much better service and surroundings than what we got here.

Overall, it wasâ€¦ fine? Nothing was obviously bad, certainly not enough to say anything, but nothing was great either. Comparing our experience to other reviews, it seems something must have been off the day we came.

If Iâ€™m in the area again I wouldnâ€™t object to coming back for another try, but I think Iâ€™d try the other nearby options first.

The vibe of the restaurant is like a cozy old town, Irish pub with the decor to match. Luckily, we arrived and there was there no waiting time. We were seated right away, and the food came extremely fast, which was great. Unfortunately the bread was cold, the food was bland, and the staff was extremely inattentive. Overall the sangria was ravioli were ok.

Beautiful spot for a cozy holiday dinner. There is a back garden area that is open in winter and covered that is lovely. The bar area is great too. They offer cheese plates and Italian cuisine. The food was just okay. I didn't have any pasta I will admit though. I did have the bruschettas which were fine and the pear and gorgonzola salad with chicken added which wasn't special. Favorite part was the chocolate salami dessert. Very tasty and easy to share at a table of multiple guests.

To me it is more about the atmosphere. Grab a reservation though, we were there on a Tuesday night and it was packed!
